definition: to go through challenging experiences/to become seasoned (in one's profession etc)
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract
variant of 摹[mo2]
to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up
to boil/to roll/to take a hike/Get lost!
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)

sentences.english: Let children play as they will unless they break their heads.
sentences.chinese: 放手让孩子玩，摸爬滚打，不头破血流就可以。

sentences.english: They’ve also had years of practice.
sentences.chinese: 而且他们已经摸爬滚打多年。

sentences.english: My future is fighting in the dark.
sentences.chinese: 我的未来在黑暗的世界里摸爬滚打。

sentences.english: He has finally learned some skill after tough training in the army for years.
sentences.chinese: 他在部队里摸爬滚打了几年，总算学到一身本事。

definition: to work hard/to try to make a living
mixed in as part of a community/hiding one's identity/occupying a position while not deserving it
to endure (years of suffering)
see 磨練|磨练[mo2 lian4]
to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
to temper oneself/to steel oneself/self-discipline/endurance
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
to play a small role
obscure and unknown (idiom); an outsider without any reputation/a nobody/an unknown quantity
to sharpen on grindstone/to improve oneself by practice
to travel extensively
to learn through experience/experience/practiced/experienced
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
to grapple (with the enemy)/to fight at the risk of one's life
to fight bravely/(fig.) to struggle/to work hard
to rebuke angrily
